results.title: War
results.brief_description: The narrator assume the role of the ‘universal soldier” who has been fighting for a million years and asks himself “why?” Asks and discuses questions like “have wars achieved anything?”, “what have soldiers and civilians died for?” and “why is every war bad?”

results.title: Wanted: dead or alive
results.creator_credit: RBC Entertainment, John Robinson, Ed Adamson, Thomas Carr and Harry Harris Jr
results.brief_description: This tape contains two episodes of the cult TV series, starring Steve McQueen as Josh Randall, the bounty hunter with a heart. In Episode 5 : “8 Cent reward”, on Christmas Eve a little boy seeks out Josh in a bar to search for a very special man, Santa Claus. Since he doesn’t want to disappoint the boy he tries to at least help him in some way - but even the best laid plans can fail. In Episode 6 : “The Choice”, Jane Koster asks Josh for help - her husband Frank is also a bounty hunter, but he isn’t as young or as fast as he used to be. He is trying to settle a score with a dangerous criminal and his wife fears he may be killed, sooner rather than later.

results.title: Wanted!: Monty Mole
results.brief_description: Wanted: Monty Mole is a platform videogame that was published in 1984. The player controls the titular mole who has to travel around a coal mine collecting pieces of coal and other miscellaneous objects while avoiding various nasties and the infamous crushers.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.description:
Wanted: Monty Mole is a platform video game that was published in 1984 by Gremlin Graphics. Versions were released for the ZX Spectrum and Commodore 64 home computers.

The player controls the titular mole who has to travel around a coal mine collecting pieces of coal and other miscellaneous objects while avoiding various nasties and the infamous crushers. The style of gameplay is typical of platform games of the 1980s. The ZX Spectrum version is a flip-screen game while the Commodore 64 version uses scrolling.
description_for_label:

The style of gameplay is typical of platform games of the 1980s. The ZX Spectrum version is a flip-screen game while the Commodore 64 version uses scrolling.

results.title: Wandering Thru' the Centre
results.brief_description:
A travel film through the centre of Australia. Features the Flying Doctor’s Base at Alice Springs, The Devil’s Marble near Wanchop, Darwin beach and harbour and many other tourist delights to be found en route from Alice Springs to Darwin.

Digitising Technician Note: Film contains footage of the making of “The Overlanders” (1946). Noted by Ben Abbott 09/01/2018

results.title: Wandering Spirit Survival School
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Lisa Turcot, Les Holdway, Marvin Midwicki and Christopher Wilson
results.brief_description: This school, organized by concerned parents, broke with tradition by introducing subjects that are of particular relevance to its pupils. Indian legends, traditions, languages and crafts balance the program of academic subjects required by the Ontario Ministry of Education. The experience of the children at Wandering Spirit is contrasted with the very different life experienced by their parents, educated in the old residential schools.

results.title: Wanda
results.creator_credit: Foundation for filmmakers and Barbara Loden
results.brief_description: A remarkable one-off from Elia Kazan’s wife. Shot in 16mm and blown up to 35mm, it’s a subtly picaresque movie about the wanderings of a semi-destitute but aimless American woman. Directing herself, Barbara Loden manages to make the character convincing in her directionless amorality, yet gradually sympathetic and even heroic. Essentially a road-movie with an existentialist backbone, the film depicts Wanda drifting into desultory relations with a bank robber, to whom she becomes attached despite his unpredictable temper. But Wanda botches everything and fails to deliver the getaway car after getting lost in a traffic jam. The story continues with our last glimpse of her back on the road, being picked up in a bar. Similar in feel to other contemporary films, “Two-Lane Black Top” and “Killing of A Chinese Bookie”, “Wanda” refuses to provide explanation or judgement of its characters and delivers a picture of both intimacy and tragedy. A neglected masterpiece of American independent film-making. Regrettably the director/star produced nothing else before her untimely death from cancer.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda (Captioned)
results.brief_description: In this humorous claymation dramatisation of Banjo Patterson’s famous poem, all of the characters, with the exception of the ill-fated sheep thief, are transformed into animals. Shot on a set designed to replicate Russell Drysdale’s Outback paintings, the film brings to life and explains the terminology of the lyrics.
